By observing the state of \\( z(t) \\) at t = T, can we determine the initial value \\( z_0 \\) without knowing if \\( h(z) \\) was applied at t = 0?
Explanation: Without knowing the application of \\( h(z) \\), it's impossible to accurately back-calculate to \\( z_0 \\) since the magnitude could have been scaled initially by \\( e^{\\alpha t} \\). The observed \\( z(t) \\) could result from various scaled versions of potential initial conditions.
